input_text:
Job Title: Product Engineer

Location: Moline, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Brandon Fobert

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $70,000 - $85,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are North America's resource for operator protection systems (cabs, ROPS/OPS, enclosures) and metal components for heavy-duty work equipment.

Why join us?

Operating from two major, closely linked manufacturing sites, your project flows smoothly and efficiently from beginning to end. Our manufacturing processes and support will continue through the life of your equipment, with capabilities for updating and modification as needs arise and technology changes come on the scene.

Job Details

Position Summary

Role is responsible for working directly with customers to create, maintain and improve the design of parts for sheet metal fabricated components and assemblies. Position is responsible for the design and development of products that are manufacturing friendly. Using predefined data, the position must efficiently and accurately process engineering quotes, release and control the design of parts to ensure external, internal, and regulatory requirements are achieved

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities as management may deem necessary from time to time.

Advances the standardization of engineering administrative functions, including bill of material development, EPICOR / CMS production systems, engineering documentation and processes, design output, verification and validation

Analyze tolerances on parts, sub-assemblies, and top level assemblies for manufacturability and tooling design

Manage multiple concurrent projects and project timelines

Strong engineering technical skills to grasp, analyze and collaborate with the customers to create designs that achieve part function, performance and durability

Participate on cross functional teams to address and resolve manufacturing problems and ensure the continuous, on-going improvement of productivity, methods, processes, and quality

Identify, analyze and mitigate risk in the design process by setting controls that prevent and detect failures (i.e. DFMEA)

Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering / Manufacturing / Technology or Equivalent (preferred)

Must have a solid manufacturing background with an understanding of sheet metal manufacturing equipment capabilities and limitations

Must be able to work in teams and demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills

Must be able to read various customer drawings, interpret datums and tolerances, and evaluate specifications

Must be able to read and interpret geometric tolerances (GD&T) and communicate to others

Ability to create parametric models (smart models); including surface modeling, solid and sheet metal modeling

Create drawings, subassemblies and part-child relationships in the CAD data structure

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Product Engineer

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
